remarks: Point inversion preserves point inversion.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 30-Jul-2019.)
statement:
mirval.p $e |- P = ( Base ` G ) $.
mirval.d $e |- .- = ( dist ` G ) $.
mirval.i $e |- I = ( Itv ` G ) $.
mirval.l $e |- L = ( LineG ` G ) $.
mirval.s $e |- S = ( pInvG ` G ) $.
mirval.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. TarskiG ) $.
mirauto.m $e |- M = ( S ` T ) $.
mirauto.x $e |- X = ( M ` A ) $.
mirauto.y $e |- Y = ( M ` B ) $.
mirauto.z $e |- Z = ( M ` C ) $.
mirauto.0 $e |- ( ph -> T e. P ) $.
mirauto.1 $e |- ( ph -> A e. P ) $.
mirauto.2 $e |- ( ph -> B e. P ) $.
mirauto.3 $e |- ( ph -> C e. P ) $.
mirauto.4 $e |- ( ph -> ( ( S ` A ) ` B ) = C ) $.
mirauto $p |- ( ph -> ( ( S ` X ) ` Y ) = Z ) $.
